title: (x) Distressed grotesque from Tazo Teas website - Faxfont {Sean Glenn}
content:
Here is another one I found on the Tazo Teas website. I’m not sure if it’s really distressed like the way it is shown or if this is a Photoshop trick. I immediately thought “CSA Images” but not there.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071101013309im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Grot_3542.png)

Thanks for helping,

Mikey :-)

 [‹ (x) Borneo Baruk Club logo - Michelangelo {Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071101013309/http:/typophile.com/node/38340 "Go to previous forum topic") [Darigold Butter Lettering - Custom? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071101013309/http:/typophile.com/node/38343 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content: There’s a guy who sells fonts for movie props. It may be one of those. Forget the URL but I’m sure someone will refresh me.

Stephen, you’re thinking of [Andrew Leman](http://web.archive.org/web/20071101013309/http:/www.ahleman.com/indexgraphics.html)’s [E-phemera](http://web.archive.org/web/20071101013309/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/ephemera/) foundry. This sample made me think of him too but I couldn’t find a match. (I recently bought his fonts Fred and Hadank, nice stuff.)

Looks like Fax Font from t26 to me.

Sean Glenn  
Art Director  
 [www.superunicorn.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20071101013309/http:/www.superunicorn.com/ "www.superunicorn.com")

Sean YOU ROCK MY LITTLE WORLD!!!

Thank you guys for all your input.

Mikey :-)
